main event: Several sightings of a ball of fire with a cone shape were reported in Texas and New Mexico on April 8, 1964.
interesting points: The object was observed passing through more than 150 degrees of arc in 4-5 seconds., The ball was at least the size of a basketball and the cone was six times its diameter., Observers described the ball as white and the cone as silver., The object was reported to have an erratic flying pattern, indicating possible meteors., There was a discrepancy in the timing of the sightings from different locations.
witness description: Female civilian identified as a housewife, estimated age around 43.
